div1.head: Report for Walter Reed, June 30, 1902
div1.p: FORM B.

(Commanding Officer's Report--under paragraphs 900 to 905, A. R., 1901. A separate blank to be used for each officer. To be forwarded to the
Adjutant General, U. S. Army, through intermediate commanders.)

EFFICIENCY REPORT OF Major Walter Reed Surgeon U.S. Army.
for the period between June 30, 1901, and June 30, 1902.

2. Succinct account of duties, and how performed
3. Habits, general conduct and bearing Excellent

5. The condition and discipline of men under his immediate control Good

10. Has he been specially mentioned, favorably or unfavorably, in official reports of commanding

[OVER.]

REMARKS: An experienced & capa-
ble medical officer

I CERTIFY that the entries herein made are true and impartial, to the best of my knowledge and
belief. I have communicated unfavorable mention as directed.

W.H. Forwood
Surgeon General
U.S. Army.

NOTE.--In answer to queries 3, 4, 5, and 6, degrees of efficiency will be expressed as “excellent,” “good,” “tolerable,”
or “not good.” Whenever an officer is marked “not good,” the reason for such answer must be clearly stated, and a copy
of that portion of the report will be furnished to the officer concerned, who will be granted a reasonable time to prepare
such written statement in respect thereto as he may desire to make; this statement will be indorsed and forwarded with
the report. Should the officer not desire to make a statement, that fact will be noted. Under the head of “Remarks,” and
appropriate explanations may be made for which other alloted spaces are insufficient. The general resourcefulness of an
officer and the manner in which he availed himself of the opportunities which have come to him should be mentioned.
Answer to query 2 must be complete.
